oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Natalie Hemby - 2017-06-10
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by Natalie Hemby from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on June 10, 2017. Accompanied by Kevin (KS) Rhodes. Includes questions from the audience. Presented in support of the exhibit American Currents: The Music of 2016.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Natalie Hemby; KS Rhodes;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments beginning in progress and songwriter introduction by Abi Tapia / (03:17) Opening comments from Natalie Hemby and introduction of next song / (04:51) You Look Like I Need A Drink / (08:24) Natalie talks about her previous job working at Comcast and introduces the next song / (11:21) Cairo, IL / (14:42) Talks about the inspiration for writing the next song / (17:00) The Bees / (22:) Asked about bringing videos with her today / (23:24) Answers question about writing with Miranda Lambert and tells story about the song White Liar / (27:35) Answers question about co-writing versus solo writing / (29:20) Answers question about lyrics or music coming first for her / (30:50) Answers question about how to start a career writing songs / (31:50) Answers question about drinking alcohol and songwriting / (33:02) Answers question about her favorite song / (34:43) Talks about next song / (35:08) This Town Still Talks About You / (39:41) Talks about next song /
(42:02) Jealous / (47:32) Talks about the next song / (50:07) Pontoon / (53:20) Closing comments / 53:51 Program end / (54:00) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hemby, Natalie; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
